title: Understanding Diabetes Management
description: Learn about the basics of diabetes, symptoms, treatment options, and how to effectively manage it with traditional and modern approaches.

lessons.title: What is Diabetes?
lessons.content:
Diabetes is a chronic health condition that affects how your body turns food into energy. Your body breaks down most of the food you eat into sugar (glucose) and releases it into your bloodstream. When your blood sugar goes up, it signals your pancreas to release insulin.

Insulin acts like a key to let the blood sugar into your body's cells for use as energy.

There are several types of diabetes:

1. **Type 1 Diabetes**: Your body doesn't make insulin or makes very little insulin. People with type 1 diabetes need to take insulin every day to survive.

2. **Type 2 Diabetes**: Your body doesn't use insulin well and can't keep blood sugar at normal levels. This is the most common type of diabetes.

3. **Gestational Diabetes**: This develops in pregnant women who have never had diabetes. It usually goes away after the baby is born, but increases the risk for type 2 diabetes later in life.

In Hawaii, diabetes is a significant health concern, with higher rates among Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders compared to other ethnic groups.

## Understanding Traditional Hawaiian Approaches to Diabetes Management

This video discusses traditional Hawaiian approaches to managing diabetes, incorporating local foods and cultural practices.
videoEmbeds: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Txqe_CAD43c?si=92SsKomckLXXZz5h" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" referrerpolicy="strict-origin-when-cross-origin" allowfullscreen></iframe>

lessons.title: Traditional and Modern Approaches
lessons.content:
Managing diabetes effectively often involves combining modern medical approaches with traditional wisdom.

**Modern Approaches**:
- Regular blood sugar monitoring
- Medication and insulin as prescribed
- Regular medical check-ups
- Exercise and physical activity

**Traditional Approaches**:
- Traditional Hawaiian foods like taro (kalo), sweet potato (Ê»uala), and fresh fish are excellent choices for blood sugar management
- Many traditional plants have properties that may help manage blood sugar levels
- Traditional physical activities like hula, paddling, and swimming provide excellent exercise

The most effective approach is one that respects both traditional knowledge and modern medicine, creating a balanced plan that works for your individual needs.

quizzes.title: Understanding Diabetes
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge about diabetes management and care

questions.questionText: What is the main hormone that regulates blood sugar levels?
questions.explanation: Insulin is the hormone produced by the pancreas that regulates blood sugar by helping glucose enter your body's cells.

questions.questionText: Which of these is NOT a common symptom of diabetes?
questions.explanation: Weight loss, not weight gain, is often a symptom of uncontrolled diabetes because the body cannot use glucose properly as an energy source.

questions.questionText: Which traditional Hawaiian food is a good choice for people with diabetes?
questions.explanation: Poi made from taro has a lower glycemic index compared to white rice or bread, making it a better choice for blood sugar management.

title: Heart Health for Hawaiians
description: Explore heart health from both traditional and modern perspectives, with culturally relevant approaches to keeping your heart strong.

lessons.title: Understanding Heart Health
lessons.content:
Your heart is a vital organ that pumps blood throughout your body, delivering oxygen and nutrients to every cell. Keeping your heart healthy is essential for overall wellbeing and longevity.

Heart disease is one of the leading causes of death in Hawaii, particularly affecting Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders at higher rates than other populations. Understanding heart health is therefore especially important for our communities.

Common heart conditions include:

1. **Coronary Artery Disease**: Narrowing of the blood vessels that supply the heart muscle with blood and oxygen

2. **Heart Failure**: When the heart can't pump blood as well as it should

3. **Arrhythmias**: Irregular heartbeats

4. **Heart Valve Disease**: When heart valves don't work properly

Many factors that increase risk for heart disease can be managed through lifestyle changes and medical care.

quizzes.title: Heart Health Basics
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge about heart health and cardiovascular disease prevention

questions.questionText: Which of these is a major risk factor for heart disease?
questions.explanation: High blood pressure is a major risk factor for heart disease as it damages the arteries over time.

questions.questionText: Which of these activities is best for heart health?
questions.explanation: Regular aerobic exercise like walking, swimming, or dancing strengthens the heart and improves circulation.

questions.questionText: Which traditional Hawaiian activity is excellent for heart health?
questions.explanation: Hula dancing is an excellent aerobic exercise that increases heart rate, improves circulation, and builds endurance.
